page.title: 08The River Severn
page.content: In our area there is a landmark called the High Rock.If you stand on top of this landmark you can see most of the town.Opposite the High Rock runs the River Severn,named after the Roman Godess Sabnina.The Severn is the fastest flowing and the longest river in England,it makes it's way south from it's small beginning in Wales to the Bristol Channel and the sea. On it's way it passes through Bridgnorth dividing the town into two halves:the High Town,perched on a sandstone mound, and the Low Town,originally a port area down in the valley.Today the riverside is made beautiful,the area around Severn Park being equipped for various games and sports, thus making it a very popular picnic area. On the other side of the A.442 Telford road lies the old town cemetery.
